Literature Review: Conceptualizations of race have been a subject of intense debate across various disciplines, with sociologists, psychologists, and anthropologists contributing to our understanding of the complex and multifaceted nature of racial categories. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the essentialist and constructivist conceptualizations of race, highlighting the key findings, attitudes, and behaviors associated with these views, as well as the factors that contribute to their persistence. We will also discuss the implications of these conceptualizations for intergroup attitudes, social policies, and structures of inequality, and present research on strategies for reducing essentialist belief systems and identifying areas for future research.
